Methods in ch.i10a.reversi.gameplay with parameters of type PlayerI
static boolean MoveHandler.checkHit(Field field, PlayerI player)
          Returns true if hit(s) are possible Example (a is the active field, r is the place the enemy is, i is where your stone is): |-----|-----|-----|-----| | a | | | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | r | | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | | r | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | | | i | |-----|-----|-----|-----|
static boolean MoveHandler.checkNeighbourEnemies(Field field, PlayerI player)
          Returns true if a neighbour is an enemy.
static java.util.List<Field> MoveHandler.getPossibleFields(PlayerI player)
          gets the possible fields to play on. determined by: if a field is played and it hits other stones, it's good to play but only if it is empty
static java.util.ArrayList<Field> MoveHandler.hitEnemyStones(Field field, PlayerI player)
          Representation of hitEnemyStones with two parameters, which is necessary for the not simulated hitEnemyStones method
static java.util.ArrayList<Field> MoveHandler.hitEnemyStones(Field field, PlayerI player, boolean simulate)
          Returns an ArrayList of Fields, which represents the beaten stones in all directions.
static void MoveHandler.printBoard(Board board, PlayerI player)
          prints out the board situation, if the program is running in debug mode
